page.title: 17DEARHAM
page.content: DEARHAM VILLAGE This is originally a farming village that expanded with the development of drift coal mining,the only remains of which are 3 spoil heaps 2 disused tramways.It has approximatley 600 dwellinds with a density of 2.27 persons per hectare.Structure 0-14 211 15-29 201 30-44 211 45-54 161 60-74 171 76+ 61 The village has no obvious centre ,it has 8 working farms.There are 135 vernacular style terraced houses made of either rough hewn redstone or dressed red sandstone with slate roofs,which where built for farmworkersand miners.3 new housing estates with mainly semi-detached houses + bungalows;rendered blockwork. Scattered throughout the village are 88 bungalows and 52 detached houses of varying age .
